NEA and the Columbia Broadcasting System have worked
together to develop a Classroom Discussion Guide for this
program. The Guide, being developed by a Committee, will
be available by the time this letter reaches you.
The Discussion Guide brings out the educational values
of the television show for the elementary and secondary
school levels with emphasis on international relations,
children of the lands visited, social studies and health.
Free copies of this Classroom Discussion Guide are avail¬
able for you and your interested teachers. For your copy
(or copies) write to National Education Association,
Box 1857> Washington, D.C.
Whether or not this kind of cooperation and these kinds
of programs are developed further will depend largely on
the response to this trial balloon, and on the final judg¬
ment of the values of this kind of service and program.
We believe that the audio visual specialist has a key role
in such determination.
